reviewText: Mariah Carey around the world is an awesome this DVD.  This new DVD comes packed with extra features and it is worth every penny you pay for it.  The DVD has superb quality and Mariah Carey shows off her wonderful talent as  always.  If you are a Mariah Carey fan you should not have to think for  more than a second to buy this DVD!
summary: If you like Mariah Carey around the world you must buy this!

reviewText: Loved it!  All the great sexy videos on a single DVD!  BUT....1) Track listings on the outside are not the same numbers as on the DVD. 2) Mariah didn't look sexy enough in the interview segments. 3) Too bad that bonus  Heartbreaker remix video is in B&W. 4) Would have liked subtitles  listing the lyrics.All in all, VERY much worth the money for Mariah  fans.  Ideal companion DVD to "Around the World.."
summary: Well worth it (with a few MINOR reservations)

reviewText: As far as music video DVD's, this is by far the best one! I would like to see the actual video for "Vision Of Love" on there because I really like it, but that's ok, the rest makes up for it. My favorite videos are "Heartbreaker," "Heartbreaker (Remix)," and "Honey." "Heartbreaker" is a great video, and Mariah looks so hot as the evil Bianca! The fighting scene is hilarious. "Honey" is a really hot video, the video that expressed Mariah's freedom and was actually what she wanted to do! It's great. "Heartbreaker (Remix)" is awesome, and she washes Snoop's car, it's funny. I love this DVD. If you liked this DVD, you whould check out the DVD "Around The World" (also by Mariah) which includes the videos for "The Roof," "Butterfly," and "Breakdown" for those of you that compained that this only had #1 videos on it. I don't think this whole #1 concept was a stupid idea, but I think a 2 or maybe 3 disk DVD set with every music video she's ever done on it would be great... of course at the end of her career, when she's done making videos. This is a really great DVD, a must have for any Mariah fan or music lover. I reccomend it to anyone! Enjoy!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Ah,Mariah carey. I will say up front that I am a big mariah carey fan. I have all of her albums, a handful of her singles, and a couple posters. As many people know, Mariah always has been one to totally dominate the  charts. She has 15 number one singles,And has sold at least a million  copies of each of her albums, certifying them platinum(I'm not so sure  about her Christmas Album,though). And as everyone knows, To promote a  single, The artist films a video and then add a certain song to the video.  Anyway,I ordered this collection. The songs pleases your ear, while the  video are meant to appeal visually and be entertaining to watch.  Anyway,this video is a collection of all of the videos for the singles by  Mariah Carey that have hit #1. Personally, I found it difficult to predict  if one of mariah's singles is going to hit another #1. Sadly,This video is  a huge waist of money. I was hugely dissapointed with this release. This  collection,is, in my opinion and jugement,is a dissapointment. A failure on  mariah's part. At the beginning of each Music video is a brief description  of the video, a word or two from mariah, that is loosely related to the  following video. Mariah mostly talks about how important her fans are to  her, and how she couldn't have done this without them, etc. Yawn.Then  came the music video. The first song on this tape is the  "Heartbreaker" which hit #1 last year, and is the first single  off her newest album, "Rainbow". It all started out good. I  rather liked the video for "Heartbreaker". It was layed out well,  was visually appealing, actually made me laugh, and managed to be unique.  The others,however, failed to entertain, or even sustain enough energy to  make it watchable. The worst is most likely "emotions". It has a  series of images of Mariah (Mariah in a car, Mariah at a party,etc). Each  of the images was a different color. As the video progress, The images  started to flash faster and faster. I must applaud those who survived this  pychodic video. Its truly painful to watch, much less view on a regular  basis. I'm surprised I survived this video. It could have probably given me  a seizure with all.. that...flashing. Luckely, most of the songs weren't as  dangerous, to harm ones sanity, but they were still pretty bad. Mariah  Carey in a hot air ballon. Mariah Carey in the middle of the sea. Mariah  carey performing weak dance moves in a grassy area. If the last couple of  sentences failed to entertain and excite you, It most likely that this  collection won't either. In most of these video's, Mariah shows of her legs  in very short shorts, or sports a bathing suit. This is entertaining at  first,but you might as well get a picture of her from one of her CD's or  off the Internet and look at that while listening to her music. Its as  rewarding,and cheaper.The only true reason to get this collection is if  you're an Mariah Carey fanatic. Think of it as a series of images of Mariah  Carey, just very weak pictures, inserted into video format . If you want to  spend your money on this wasteful video, save it and buy her wonderful  album, "Daydream" or "#1" which by it's self is a cool  album. This video collection, however, is painful to watch. Take my word  for it, this will do far from entertain.

reviewText: This is a great collection but it could have had a little more to offer.  I enjoy the live performances of Vision of Love, Love Takes Time, and Someday but they should have also included the official videos for those songs since they were only previously available on vhs format.  I am glad to see Mariah commenting on each song and video.  I wish the remix videos were also available that would be cute.
summary: This DVD is for the LAMBS
Title: N/A

reviewText: The video for Heartbreaker more than makes up for the rest of the collection's shortcomings!  That one is totally hilarious!  I didn't realize just much fun that video was!  I was disappointed, however, that the video for SOMEDAY was live.  I wanted to hear the remix version of the song that was used for the video.  All in all, it is a fair collection, but I think they need to come out with a complete video collection that includes some of the minor hits like "THE ROOF".  I think this project would make an excellent Sony/Def Jam collaboration!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Mariah's #1's DVD features 14 of her #1 hits, in video form. Its a nice collection, but I have a few faults with it. First, the original videos are missing. For a lot of them (esp. the early ones) we get live versions of the video, which is nice, but it would have been nice to have the original ones. Second, the DVD only features her videos for the songs that went to #1, what about all the other great videos she made? Like "Butterfly", "Breakdown", "Anytime You Need A Friend", etc, where are they? I realize its called #1's, but the whole idea seems rather dumb, especially since Sony just released their GH for Mariah, it would have been more fitting to scrap the whole #1's cd, VHS and DVD, and wait for that, because then it would be a more complete video collection. Hopefully one day fans are treated to a full collection of all her videos, but this is nice for the purpose it does serve, including her #1 videos.
Title: N/A

Hopefully, Mariah will comes up with her ultimate collections video which will contains all her video in one disc someday!

reviewText: This is an excellent dvd.  It covers so many good songs and hits.  I love them all.  The only thing that was slightly disappointing was Whenever You Call being live.  I don't usually like live music unless I'm at a concert, and I would have really loved to see a video for this.  The music is fantastic even if the videos are somewhat corny (because this girl LOVES herself).  Now she'd have a couple of more number 1's to add to this if it had been made now.  Well that's OK.  There will be more number 1's for a long time yet, so there can be another dvd collection of all the hits.  If you are a true fan - go get this (if you don't already).

reviewText: Love Mariah Carey but this DVD really falls short. Videos for Vision Of Love, Love Takes Time and Someday are replaced by live performances found on her other DvDs.Didn't Sony release Greatest Hits and then Essential Mariah Carey? How about giving us the complete set of original videos done by Mariah during her tenure at Sony?In cases like these, patience is indeed a virtue.

reviewText: Mariah Carey's #1's certainly reminds me of the power of the past. One of my professors would say that we currently are living in times of deception where the power and its true meaning of many things have gone astray. Mariah has always loved to sing and this is clearly reflected in her videos and performances. Music used to be about emotions and escapism, with a lot of deeper intentions and emotions. It was intended to find peace. Today, music has evolved into a form in which the vocals are no longer as much emphasized, but the looks, glamours, and the physical appearance of the artist. Perhaps American Idol is a positive thing in which original and classical hits are sung. I have always held a philosophy that the "original" is always the best. Kelly Clarkson is certainly a magnificent artist in her vocals. The lyrics of her music is soulful. Mariah Carey's music is a reminder of the initial intention of music-that people sang because they sang

reviewText: Of course Video didn't make Mariah famous as her own voice gave her the status she achieve from 1990-1997...where she was the queen of the billboard charts!...but her Videos are funny and a way to spend your sunday afternoon.  VISION OF LOVE live? didn't care that much for this!...LOVE TAKES TIME  what happen with the beach and the whole white and black thang, this video was stolen from Chris Isaak Mind....I DON'T WANNA CRY Mariah! please clean your aparment now!....SOMEDAY...Live :( well the original was awful...kid Mariah in the school....EMOTIONS first good Mariah Vid...not boring...although she spent most of the time wasting gas on that car!...DREAMLOVER huhuhuhuh...this will be the first video of Mariah to make it to the list of timeless videos..the field, the balloon, her dog, and the dancers...good vid...ooops and Mariah in short jeans and franel shirt...HERO live hate those live videos, hat that shoot of the girl crying on Mariah's songs...this ruin the whole mood of the vid...hero is one of that songs that are better off without the vid..FANTASY...ODB ties a Clown, The Nacho Girl in the beginning..Mariah rides the skates and the rollercoater...and jump on the jumping JEEp...can Mariah get any hyper than that?...anyway good and timeless video too....ONE SWEET DAY..cheap video....overplayed song...Mariah and the Four Ninja Turtles....Mariah looks bored to death in this Video...that's what you get when you hang out too much with people that are no fun....ALWAYS BE MY BABY...i wish Mariah would have taken a plunge and come out with a white t.shirt contest...hihihi kidding....well Mariah's Camp all over the place...cheesy. HONEY well angent Honey got it all figured out...NO POR FAVOR....the spanish...P Daddy and the whole James Bond idea...Mariah swimming in high heels....that's just pure entertaiment..nice movie!..oops video!...MY ALL....hummmmmm good vid...one of Mariah's best...HEARTBREAKER...well fun, carefree, and Mariah dance for the second time, I have a uqestion Mariah did you did the Choreography in the Lobby Scene at the Theather?..the old man is funny, and the fight is utterly maximus fun fact....this is just it...MARIAH'S videos are not her best quality....but since she's a 90's diva...a most have....*****FIVE STARS(for the fun fact)
summary: MARIAH'S VIDEOS ARE CLASSIC IN THEIR OWN WAY.

reviewText: This DVD Is Great It Has Mariah's Best Video's & Live Performances....The Videos...1. Heartbreaker (Feat. Jay Z)2. My All3. Honey4. Always Be My Baby5. One Sweet Day (Feat. Boyz 2 Men)6. Fantasy (Feat. O.D.B.)7. Dreamlover8. Emotions9. I Don't Wanna Cry10. Heartbreaker Remix (Feat. Missy Elliot & Da Brat)All The Videos Come With Dolby Digital 5.1 Surround Sound & PCM Stereo... Except Heartbreaker Remix It Only Comes In 2.0 Surround Sound...The Performances...1. Hero2. I'll Be There (Feat. Trey Lorenz)3. Someday4. Love Takes Time5. Vision Of LoveThe Performances Also Come With 5.1 Sound & PCM Stereo...The Performances Are From Mariah Carey Live At Madison Square Garden, Mariah Carey & Mariah Carey Unplugged... And Before Each Video Mariah Tells You About The Song... And It Comes With A Biography And It Has Most Of The Awards She Has Got.... And It Dosen't Come With Subtitles So Thats The Only Bad Thing... lol..Get This DVD And You Wont Regret It...
